intro: Calorophus erostris, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ragwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in composite heads. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is found in various regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It has lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Calorophus erostris is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
